definition: to tag sb with unfair label/power word

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code
hat/cap
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: But labelling the Rightists is a different matter.
sentences.chinese: 只有扣帽子一事，對右派當別論。

sentences.english: This is another kind of labeling due to prejudices.
sentences.chinese: 這是基於偏見的另一種扣帽子方法。

sentences.english: The middle elements are sincere in their opposition to labelling.
sentences.chinese: 中間派反對扣帽子是真實的。

sentences.english: There are 3 "Dance Routines, " labeled Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced.
sentences.chinese: 有3個“舞蹈動作，”扣帽子初級，中級和高級。

definition: to bludgeon/to hit with a big stick
to make a scapegoat of sb/to defame/to slander
(coll.) to be the object of flattery/to be placed on a pedestal
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to grab sb by the pigtail/to seize on weak points/to exploit the opponent's shortcomings
(lit.) to splash dirty water/(fig.) to throw mud at/to smear (sb)
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to define
tall conical paper hat worn as a public humiliation/dunce cap/(fig.) flattery
to start a rumor
to slander/to smear/to vilify
to discuss sth on its own merits/to judge the matter as it stands
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to buckle up/to fasten
personal attack
